    Individual-based disease models

    In efforts to futher explore how community composition affects disease risk, I wrote an individual-based disease model to accompany my mesocosm experiment. My data from the mesocosm experiment will allow me to validate my model so I can explore additional starting parameters. The model is a spatially explicit discrete time model that tracks state changes for all individuals over the duration of the epidemic. Once I figure out how to properly render the mathematical notation on this website, Iâ€™ll post it. Until then, check out my personal notes on how the model works and simulation results for 2-species and 6-species communities:
